{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3414861,"name":"Ardiano Works","username":"MSU2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msu2000/{size}/190139_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T16:48:54.363Z","cooked":"

So, we’re just doing home summer project here, so budget is limited. We forgot to set limit on the Sparkmaxes and toasted them. We’re not even on the ground yet (REV Swerve). I’m imagining we will fry something else eventually. At $90/piece, this gets very expensive fast.

Questions:

  1. What’s the best practice before firing up motor and motor controller. We learned that setting limit is a must. what else?
  2. Can the fried SparkMaxes be refurbished?
  3. Mechanically, we tested (by feel) the driver train before firing it up, this is basically the only guarantee that the drive and steering gears are working. IS there torque spec range that you follow that indicates the system is assembled properly?
    Thanks
","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T16:53:54.236Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":181,"readers_count":180,"score":81.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469767,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-and-neo-test","display_username":"Ardiano Works","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57747,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-and-neo-test/469767/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3414873,"name":"Graham Howard","username":"grahamsh","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/grahamsh/{size}/188294_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T16:58:12.844Z","cooked":"
  1. Current limits, like you said, are the biggest thing. I’d also make sure all of your offsets are correct (using the tool provided with MaxSwerve).
  2. Not really, although sometimes you can get broken OOTB ones replaced by REV
  3. The biggest problems would likely be misassembly of gears etc, not entirely sure if torque spec would help there. We go hand tight and have never had any issues.
","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T16:58:12.844Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":162,"readers_count":161,"score":37.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469767,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-and-neo-test","display_username":"Graham Howard","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57939,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"frctools.com"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-and-neo-test/469767/2","custom_user_title":"frctools.com","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414886,"name":"Travis Norris","username":"TNorris","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tnorris/{size}/203666_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T17:11:49.044Z","cooked":"
MSU2000:

IS there torque spec range that you follow that indicates the system is assembled properly?

A torque spec for the bolts or for the drive/steering itself?

Make sure each module can steer and drive by hand through more than one rotation before powering it on. It’s possible that the modules steer fine in a small range but bind up when you go through an entire 360 degree spin.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T17:11:49.044Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":141,"readers_count":140,"score":38.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469767,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-and-neo-test","display_username":"Travis Norris","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":39882,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Head Coach - FRC 2423 | NEMC Planning Committee"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-and-neo-test/469767/3","custom_user_title":"Head Coach - FRC 2423 | NEMC Planning Committee","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3414902,"name":"Ardiano Works","username":"MSU2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/msu2000/{size}/190139_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T17:42:13.653Z","cooked":"

For the drive/steering wheel itself. This determines the bolts and screws for assy. I found that the tiny 3mm holding the 550 drive train is finicky and needs to be at certain torque setting in order for steering to turn properly

How did you figure out the dead OOTB ones before powering it up?

Simply stalling the spark max shouldn’t damage them. Are you sure this is the root cause, and are you use the spark max is damaged? I recommend emailing REV support on that.

There is one known way to damage spark max that I believe involves screwing in a NEO550 too far, but I don’t know details off hand.

Not 100% sure if this is the root cause, but seems like by process of elimination, we think it is the SparkMax. Talking to REV already and they’ll help troubleshoot it. The Spark LED is blinking certain combination with corresponding joystick controller movement.

You might want to make a brushless motor tester; really handy for sorting out “does this run at all” before you get a SparkMax and real current involved in it. Revision 2 leaves all the motor stuff in place and just adds the three phase Anderson connection. SUPER useful when you run NEOs!

Brushless Motor Controller Tester Control System
And the latest product of the mad science labs: the brushless equivalent of the drill motor with anderson connectors… A drill motor with THREE anderson connectors! It turns out that you can solder in to the leads on a brushless drill carcass (I swear the business end was already gone when I got it). A little surgery to put in a three pole connector. And then a little scope creep I realized that I could press fit a 1/2" hex onto the motor shaft and also get a tool that could spin stuf…
